summary:
I am a Lead data scientist with several years of experience in data analysis, statistics, machine learning, software development, and leadership. I worked at CERN during my formative years. There, I obtained a PhD in Experimental Physics and four extra years of scientific research experience. During this time, I was part of one of the two experiments that were fundamental for the 2013 Nobel Prize in Physics award.

Difficult challenges motivate me, I use them to expand the limits of my knowledge. I like to approach problems from a global point of view, finding the best solutions after considering several possible options. I am a self-starter and an explorer. I like to take new ideas and identify their commercial or scientific potential. I am self-motivated and resilient, and I get a lot of my energy motivating people around me. 

I believe leadership is about setting the right standards and the right example. As part of a team, my main objective is that my contributions improve the team's status quo. I often take a supportive role, and I make sure I remove the problems my colleagues can face in order to set the team up for success. I help people with their own development aiming to get the best version of what they want to be. I believe that maximizing people’s potential leads to the best possible results.

profile_positions.description: As the Owner Data Scientists at Coolblue, I am in charge of creating and implementing the vision of data science within the company. I am the contact point for data science topics in the company. I mentor and lead by example the data scientists allocated in different domains. I make sure that the processes data scientists follow and the standards they use to guarantee quality and deliver value to Coolblue are updated with the latest knowledge of the profession. I also keep Data Scientists' motivation and skills sharp in order to have a competitive team that is constantly delivering the required value. Finally, I make sure that the company recruit the best possible data scientists to keep our models sharp.
profile_positions.title: Owner Data Scientists

profile_positions.description:
I am the team leader of the data science teams for pricing and marketing. I am responsible for the performance of the teams, and the direct manager of the team members. With the teams, we worked on several machine learning projects, among them: ab-testing, proactive pricing (automatic pricing), product market price modelling, estimations of the time to sell second chance products, customer lifetime value, purchase intent, and customer interest estimations, among others. 
Together with the teams, I designed, prototyped, validated, implemented, tested, documented, and deployed these products in production environments.
profile_positions.title: Data Science Team Lead

profile_positions.description: I worked as a Full stack Senior Data Scientist, I was involved in bayesian ab-testing, optimal allocation of delivery employees, optimal pricing, among others.
profile_positions.title: Senior Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
I was in charge of designing, prototyping, validating, implementing, testing, and documenting a hospital IoT system used for workflow improvement in the surgical zone of hospitals. 
In the definition phase of this project, I coauthored the patents used by the system, identified and documented the requirements of the system, defined the architecture, designed the data model of the sensors and the machine learning strategy of the system.
For the implementation phase I implemented the machine learning software, contributed in the ISO27001 certification, contributed with IEC-60601 requirement revision, performed constant system integration and configuration, lead the team in scientific topics, contributed with the testing effort of the system, calibrated the sensors, lead the deployment effort in the first hospitals, had constant contact with clients and commercial leads, contributed constantly with milestone planning and performance tracking. I was heavily involved in the management and definition of the product. 

In parallel with the healthcare activities, I helped with the business development of the company in the Machine Learning area. This was done mostly by visiting clients and understanding their data-related problems to offer them optimal data solutions.

Our technological stack is C++, Python, Java, Angular + electron, Docker, psql, Pivotal, Keras, Tensorflow, Scikit, Sklearn, Pandas, Numpy, git, svn.
profile_positions.title: Software & ML architect

profile_positions.description: As a design engineer for YER my role was to work as an external design engineer for ASML.
profile_positions.title: Design Engineer

profile_positions.description:
As part of the Focus group I was thinking and developing improvements in the Focus software for the ASML lithography machines. I contributed to the validation of new implementations. I worked with machine learning algorithms to identify interesting regions in the data coming from the clients. I wrote an internal document explaining the software implementation and validation.
Technological Stack: Matlab, svn.
profile_positions.title: Design Engineer

profile_positions.description:
LucidBlue was a company that aimed to create a wearable device used to track the UV radiation received by individuals, in parallel the company was creating an application that would serve as a health coach for the wearable users. Our coach was an app that used data collected with wearable's to communicate to users the consequences of the interactions with the environment. I was the Software architect of the project. 
Our technology stack was Android, HTML5, CSS, PHP, Python, Firebase, JQuery.
profile_positions.title: Software Architect & Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
I developed SCADA software that controls the Resistive Plate Chambers in the RPC project in the CMS experiment. This system was written in WinCC (former PVSS). I was developing in C sharp and working on an Agile like environment. Monthly status reports were required for relevant stakeholders.
Technological stack: C#, SQL.
profile_positions.title: CMS Experiment, RPC Detector SCADA Developer

profile_positions.description:
I was part of the physics group in charge of analysing the data produced by the LHC and the CMS experiment, specifically I was searching for signatures of new physics compatible with the theory of Supersymmetry. To perform these searches I was: constantly analyzing terabytes of data using the grid of the CMS experiment; constantly doing hypothesis testing using likelihood ratio test, frequentists, and Bayesian methods; using machine learning algorithms(BDT, and NN) to classify data into signal and background; forecasting backgrounds levels to later on subtract them from the data; guiding PhD students; giving tutorials on data analysis, CMS software, C++, and statistics. 
Technological stack: C++, Python, SQL, bash, svn, git, ROOT, Grid computing.
Algorithms: Boosted decision trees, Neural Networks.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral-Researcher , Ghent University

profile_positions.description:
I lead the Detector Performance group of the Resistive Plate Chambers detectors. This position included the responsibility of: guaranteeing a 99% uptime as well as a 95% efficiency for the RPC detectors during data collection (several hundreds of detectors, and thousands of readout channels collecting data at a 25 ns frequency); leading the data analysis group of the RPC detectors; plan milestones and deadlines for physical results and reviews; maintaining and modifying the architecture of several software projects that included: displaying, storing, and analyzing large streams of data on web applications; reviewing and internally approving physics results of our detector, coordinating simulation efforts to study and better understand the performance of the detectors.
Technological stack: C++, Python, SQL, svn, git, ROOT.
profile_positions.title: CMS Experiment, RPC Detector Performance Group Convener

profile_positions.description:
I was part of the physics group in charge of analysing the data produced by the LHC and the CMS experiment, specifically I was searching for signatures of new physics compatible with the theory of Supersymmetry. To perform these searches I was: constantly analyzing terabytes of data using the grid of the CMS experiment; constantly doing hypothesis testing using likelihood ratio test, frequentists and Bayesian methods; using machine learning algorithms(BDT, and NN) to classify data into signal and background; forecasting backgrounds and signal levels. During this period I was also heavily involved in the commissioning as well as in the data analysis effort of the RPC detectors.
Technological stack: C++, Python, SQL, bash, svn, git, ROOT.
Algorithms: Boosted decision trees, Neural Networks.
profile_positions.title: PhD Student Physics, CMS Experiment & University of Los Andes

profile_positions.description: Gave several complementary courses in Physics.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: I was a geometry teacher for 3rd year High School students.
profile_positions.title: Math Teacher
